reviews.title: Ouch!
reviews.text: Having stayed at the palace in the past, I found myself there once again attending a party in the ballroom. Having booked a room for the night, I found the room to be mediocre,however, the meal served to our party was vile in no uncertain terms. I have been known to eat most things put before me. Not this time! I was utterly disgusted when taking into consideration the price paid and the star rating of the hotel. To add insult to injury, after paying a visit to the little girls room, the toilet seat and lid fell off and hit me on the toe! All this and post-refurbishment!??!

reviews.title: A very pleasant surprise
reviews.text: I was a bit concerned having read some of the reviews and having booked over the internet. What a pleasant surprise. I did not get one of the refurbished contemporary rooms, but mine was fine for myself and my daughter. Clean and comfortable. It was in the mez floor, but I had asked for a quiet room and it was. Only the very faint rumble of a train. The staff were great and very helpful. I would certainly stay there again.

Only complaints - one bath and hand towel. After mentioning it to reception a note was made and I am sure had I complained that evening another towel would have arrived. Perhaps (similar to the previous reviewer) also the tele - but as I wasn't in the room much - not a problem really.
reviews.title: New 'Contemporary' Rooms are wonderful

reviews.text: The company books my hotels so I don't get much choice in where I stay. Had been booked into The Palace before - a reasonable though quite warm room (until the air-con kicked in) down the the maze of the lower basement. So I thought my recent stay would be reasonable, but nothing to write home about.
reviews.title: Is this the Same Hotel

reviews.text: Walking into the finally refurbished foyer, I was struck by how much better it looked. Very classy. Quickly got booked in, and was advised that since I had stayed before I would be getting a free upgrade into one of the new 'Contemporary' rooms (or since it was available and only for one night).
reviews.title: A Excellent Choice
Perfectly decent hotel
reviews.text: I stayed here with a group of friends when visiting Manchester for the weekend. I gathered from reading the reivews that some people were not happy with the place but i couldnt find any cause for complaint. We got a good deal for the rooms and perhaps its luck of the draw but the room i shared was spacious and clean. It also - charmingly - seemed to have been created around an existing canal archway, the archway forming part of the room wall. The others were in rooms of varying sizes and quality but nobody had complaints.
We didn't eat in the hotel but the bar seemed perfectly adequate if a little staid. It was also a bit of a hassle to get late drinks but the staff were friendly enough.
reviews.title: Very Surprising

reviews.text: The location is prefect also. The university area and the city centre are within walking distance and we got to Old Trafford (to watch our game) within 20 minutes in a taxi.
reviews.title: Not a palatial Palace

reviews.text: All in all, i would be more than happy to stay here again.
reviews.title: Eat in this hotel but don't stay in it !!

reviews.text: Having been booked into this hotel by my company I started reading reviews of it which, by and large, were less than favourable. I arrived in Manchester late and worried that I'd made a terrible mistake! How wrong could I be - arriving at the hotel the receptionist started by apologising for me having to wait to book in - there was one person in front of me, and I'd spent the time just taking in the architecture - and continued to book me in efficiently and quickly. He directed me to the lift and my room, which was on the first floor overlooking Oxford Road and the Cornerhouse. This meant the room was a bit noisy, but not unduly so considering that this is a main road - I certainly didn't need the earplugs I'd taken with me after reading previous reviews.
reviews.title: Fantastic - Wonderful Hotel
Could be .....
reviews.text: This Hotel is decidedly oddball. Location is fine for just about all of central Manchester. The Hotel is huge and rambling and the room quality / size/ cleanliness varies enormously. Given the prices - which I consider almost extortionate - stamp your feet and demmand a decent room. Many of them are large, well equipped, have a decent bathroom and other facilities and are well kept up but others I saw are decidedly not. It pays to pay out a ball of white string with you from reception so you can find your way back - the geography is somewhat confusing.

The one evening meal I had was far from inedible but took for ever to arrive and the service was a bit offhand. With Chinatown and a myriad of other restaurants within striking distance I would recommend eating out although the breakfast is perfectly adequate.Alhtough the building itself doesn't really lend itself to a hotel conversion (parts of it resemble the interior of an upmarket gents urinal) things could be so much better with further room upgrades, better housekeeping and a more helpful attitude from the staff generally.
reviews.title: Poor Hotel - would not recommend!!!

reviews.text: what a rip off, first night i stayed in a basement room, could hear trains going past all night, second night, i was on the 4th floor, and could hear traffic from below all night with no option to close secondary windows to drown out the noise. Also cob webs in the rooms i stayed, and had to wait 5 minutes for hot water! and i paid about £250 for 2 nights!
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.text: stay well clear!!
reviews.title: An unexpected gem
very average
reviews.text: Hi I read the reviews from some people, I have stayed at this hotel 4 times, moving from another well known hotel in MCR, I have always been very happy with my rooms. 2 double beds in each of the rooms i have stayed , even though its been just me and my daughter, VERY CLEAN, agree the prices for drinks a little steep.

reviews.title: The Palace? A Glaring Misnomer
reviews.text: It's a bit of a bait and switch at the Palace: lure you in with a beautifully renovated lobby and restaurant and then stick you in a worn and torn room whose last bit of tender loving care was 10 years previous to your arrival. The short story is that I had to change rooms twice and ended up with accommodation lacking heat (maintenance tried to fix twice, but gave up) and bedside lighting. In the end I was too exhausted to complain and they did not seem to care. The first room was in the basement, very small with bars over a frosted window. The second room was enormous, but lacked heat and sound insulation. Given that the train tracks were only a stones throw away the night was anything, but restful. The staff were not particularly friendly and begrudged having to accommodate.

Although I looked forward to staying at the Palace, having seen it in pictures and just thought 'Wow'. the actual experience didn't live up to my expectations. Slow check in, wrong reservation, badly directed to the room, to find that there were someone elses belongings in there already were my first 10 minutes experience, and it only went downhill from there... All in all this hotel needs to get it's act together to compete with the many quality hotels in Manchester. Just to clarify, I will not be returning, and I urge others to do the same until things change.
reviews.title: Not up to scratch
Impressed and very relieved!
reviews.text: Like many others, I was was very nervous about our planned stay in the Palace Hotel after reading some of the other reviews. I phoned the hotel the week before we were due to arrive to confirm the booking I made online and to voice my concern about the state of some of the rooms according to reviews I'd read - in the hope that we'd be ensured a good room! First of all after putting me on hold several times and transferring me to a few different people they eventually confirmed that they'd misread the intial internet booking so only had me booked in for 1 night instead of 2 but that it was all sorted now. When I mentioned reviews about the hotel rooms and enquired about the type of room we'd be staying in, I was told that we were booked into a standard room and that there were plenty of reviews on the internet about how good the hotel was too! I didnt bother getting into it with her any more but was a bit nervous when we arrived at the hotel. We were very impressed upon entry into the hotel. The concierge on reception was friendly enough but failed to put my mind at rest as to why he was adding a further £100 onto the agreed price which he was swiping onto my Visa. He (just about) managed to explain that this was some sort of cover but that only the original amount quoted would be debited when we checked out. When we checked out 2 days later, this was as he confirmed and only the original price was swiped on my Visa.

When we eventually found our room after checking in (very poor directions were given to us at reception so we ended up back at reception with our bags and were eventually accompanied to our rooms by a member of staff - otherwise we would never have found it!), we were very impressed. We were obviously in the old part of the hotel - the room was enormous with a huge bed and a lovely large bathroom. I admit that the decor was a little dated but it was spotless and there was absolutely nothing that we could have complained about. Once we got our bearings, we had no trouble finding our way in and out of the hotel from our room and although the corridors were long, I wouldn't describe them as dark like I had read about in some other reviews. We never went into the hotel bar as although it looked very smart and modern, there was no atmosphere in the place and the drink seemed a lot more expensive than in the pubs nearby. We'd definitely come back and stay in the Palace.
reviews.title: A Mish Mash of a Hotel

reviews.text: Stayed at the Palace Hotel for two nights in Feb 06. Hotel is a real mish mash of styles and age and much has been done to update the hotel. However, whilst the ground floor areas are quite impressive, the rest of the hotel - including the corridors and lifts - really needs attention.
reviews.title: Faded Glory
